quest.name: Brainy Bears
journal: Dagasi fears for the local livestock.

dialogue.name: DAGASI
dialogue.text: You look like a fine warrior to me, and I am rarely wrong.

dialogue.name: DAGASI
dialogue.text: You may not be a Dotharl, but if you have experience slaying beasts, there is something I would ask of you.

dialogue.name: DAGASI
dialogue.text: A group of creatures has appeared near the village recently. They pose a threat to our sheep. Up until now they had only been sighted much further north.

dialogue.name: DAGASI
dialogue.text: Our tribe is home to many a brave warrior. We fear not death. However, gulo gulo are one of the few beasts that trouble even our finest warriors.

dialogue.name: DAGASI
dialogue.text: That is why I wish to entrust an outsider with this task. I would have you slay four of the creatures. Do not worry, you shall be compensated.

dialogue.name: DAGASI
dialogue.text: Slay four of the creatures. Succeed and you shall be compensated.

dialogue.name: DAGASI
dialogue.text: The deed is done? Good, now our sheep can rest easy.

dialogue.name: DAGASI
dialogue.text: As you may have noticed, the gulo gulo is a wily creature. It lures its attackers into a sense of false security before springing a trap on them. That was how my brother met his end.

dialogue.name: DAGASI
dialogue.text: While they are intelligent, they are still beasts. But one must be careful when attempting to slay them. Many a Dotharl has mistaken recklessness for bravery, losing their lives in the process.

dialogue.name: DAGASI
dialogue.text: I imagine our warriors would benefit from studying someone like you. I shall make sure to teach my brother not to be so foolhardy in his next life.

dialogue.name: DAGASI
dialogue.text: Thank you for your aid. I shall make sure we do not require outside help the next time a gulo gulo appears.
